basics.name: Jim Park
basics.label: I've got DevOps on Vinyl
basics.summary: I focus on using technology to drive software delivery performance and make software performance and security visible.

work.summary: Provided technical leadership focusing on AWS, DataDog, and GitHub Actions.
highlights: Created an open source pull request preview system using Github Actions, AWS App Mesh (a service mesh technology), and AWS ECS.
Developed a continuous deployment pipeline leveraging Github pull requests for managing the terraform lifecycle.
Established the standards for writing alerts and dashboards in DataDog.
Wrote and open sourced a datadog_backup tool for backing up DataDog dashboards and monitors.

work.summary: I work with companies to design and build infrastructure that is tailored for the specific needs of startups.
highlights: Created custom Preview And Deploy infrastructure for multiple customers.
Wrote custom Helm chart for customers using Kubernetes, as well as development pipelines for that Helm chart and the application.
Built a dynamically scaling runner pool for GitLab CI, reducing average build time by 75%.

work.position: Member of the Technical Staff - Head of Operations
work.summary: I was responsible for establishing our operations practices. We were able to operate with the agility of a startup, and the risk controls of a multinational bank.
highlights: From Ideation to Production in 24 hours.

work.summary: We developed the standards for deploying open source CloudFoundry.
highlights: I designed and oversaw the creation of the first self-running, self-repairing and self-updating Cloud Foundry Platform as a Service for a Fortune 500 customer.
Updated 300+ container hosts running 50,000+ containers multiple times a week.
Developed the reference material and source code for monitoring CloudFoundry on DataDog.

work.summary: I was responsible for Wildbit's OpenIndiana and CentOS servers configured using Chef.
I was responsible for managing our over one thousand servers using Puppet, incident response and data center operations.
I was responsible for configuring Juniper network devices and using puppet to automate the configuration of backend and client-side servers.
I worked with small business customers in configuring their LAMP stack servers, performing disk recovery, and troubleshooting networking issues.
I built computer labs using Norton Ghost.

highlights: In OIF II, I reduced the average turnaround time from 3+ months to same day or next day for over 50% of new work orders.
